channel.title: Good News Network
channel.description: A Daily Dose of Positive News to Enthuse

item.title: Jon Stewart Says Goodbye to The Daily Show With A Little Help From Friends
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
After 16 years at the helm of Comedy Central’s fake news program, The Daily Show, comedian Jon Stewart signed off yesterday during a special one-hour goodbye show. He was joined by ”senior correspondents” who had helped propel the show to number one among 18-35 year old viewers looking for satirical

The post Jon Stewart Says Goodbye to The Daily Show With A Little Help From Friends appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Posing With Your Family On The Beach? Try It With Yoga
item.dc:creator: Ethel Baumberg
item.description:
With summertime in full swing, many families are hitting the beach. Instead of sitting on the beach chair all day, though, why not grab your kids and move around? Exercising on sand is, according to one study, more effective and even better for your body than a firm surface. So, in honor

The post Posing With Your Family On The Beach? Try It With Yoga appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Study Shows Drinking Coffee Could Cut Risk of Diabetes by Half
item.dc:creator: Linda Hernandez
item.description:
Besides a jolt of caffeine to get you through your day, a long-term study shows that coffee may have additional ‘perks’… Researchers say an inflammation-lowering effect of the beverage could be the reason coffee drinkers were 54 percent less likely to develop type 2 diabetes as non-coffee drinkers, as

The post Study Shows Drinking Coffee Could Cut Risk of Diabetes by Half appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Stranger’s Facebook Post Spurs Kindness for Widowed Dad -WATCH
item.dc:creator: Sheila Key
item.description:
Last week, a father was shocked by the kindness that rained down on him, courtesy of a fellow parent and the strangers she rallied on Facebook. Marc Sable had just lost his wife, Belinda, 28, to ovarian cancer, and as an overnight custodian was wondering how he was possibly going to provide for

The post Stranger’s Facebook Post Spurs Kindness for Widowed Dad -WATCH appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: What Are These Seniors Doing At a Skateboard Park? (WATCH)
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
We all know seniors need to keep their minds and bodies active, but taking folks from an assisted living center to the local skateboard park seems a bit extreme. It turns out Cody Kohlhagen knew what he was doing all along. The Activities Director at Willowbrook Place headed out with his group of spunky seniors

The post What Are These Seniors Doing At a Skateboard Park? (WATCH) appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Grandparents Convert House Into “Safe School” for Bullied Students
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
At least 20 kids have recovered from years of bullying thanks to a special “safe school” founded by a pair of grandparents in the U.K.. Three years ago, Fred and Vivian Morgan turned their 10-bedroom home into a private school called Northleigh House School in Hatton, Warwick, in order to

The post Grandparents Convert House Into “Safe School” for Bullied Students appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Good News in History, August 7
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
58 years ago today, The Quarrymen played at the Cavern Club in Liverpool, (without Paul McCartney who was away at Boy Scout camp). The Cavern was still a jazz club, with only some tolerance for skiffle music, so when John Lennon dared to play ‘Hound Dog’ and ‘Blue Suede Shoes’,

The post Good News in History, August 7 appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Beyond Carrot Sticks: Serve Great Party Foods That Don’t Pack on Pounds
item.dc:creator: Helaina Hovitz
item.description:
When you’re watching what you eat, party can sound like a four letter word. Have no fear: if you’re throwing the shindig yourself—or attending someone else’s— nibbles nutritionist Tanya Zuckerbrot gave us these suggestions to keep you on a nutritious, yet yummy, track. OUT: Crab Cakes   IN: Shrimp Cocktail Classic crab

The post Beyond Carrot Sticks: Serve Great Party Foods That Don’t Pack on Pounds appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: After Wedding, Instead of Fancy Meal Couple Serves 4000 Syrian Refugees
item.dc:creator: Helaina Hovitz
item.description:
A young Turkish couple wanted to celebrate their wedding day by bringing happiness to some of the refugees who have fled Syria since the outbreak of the civil war four years ago. Fethullah Üzümcüoğlu and Esra Polat, who married last week in a province near the Syrian border, pooled the money

The post After Wedding, Instead of Fancy Meal Couple Serves 4000 Syrian Refugees appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: How a Divine Chocolate Company Gives Women Workers a Sweet Life in Ghana
item.dc:creator: Sheila Key
item.description:
Unwrap a bar of Divine Chocolate and you’ll find…not a golden ticket, but the story of one of the company’s owners. Peel back one more —why not? Life is short!—and the stories inside may continue to surprise you. That’s because, as the only fair-trade chocolate maker owned by a farmers cooperative,

The post How a Divine Chocolate Company Gives Women Workers a Sweet Life in Ghana appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Baby Otter Learns How to be an Otter From Expert Humans
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
This wee one has been enrolled in Otter School. “Luna” was only a week old when found lost and alone on a California beach. Weighing just two pounds at the time, she was taken in by Chicago’s Shedd Aquarium, where people have been teaching her the ways of the world — an otter’s world

The post Baby Otter Learns How to be an Otter From Expert Humans appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Mountain Gorilla Population Bounces Back, Quadruples to 1000
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
The largest population of mountain gorillas in the world has grown to four times the size of its once-dwindling number, as poaching has become virtually non-existent among the magnificent apes of Virunga National Park in the Democratic Republic of Congo. Nearly 1,000 gorillas live in the park now, quadruple the number

The post Mountain Gorilla Population Bounces Back, Quadruples to 1000 appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Teens Rescue 89-yr-old Who Didn’t Know Her House Was On Fire
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
An elderly South Carolina woman didn’t realize her house was on fire until two teenage neighbors pulled her out of the burning building. Logan Campbell and step-brother James Brown were startled by an exploding electrical transformer in the middle of the night. When they went to check it out, they

The post Teens Rescue 89-yr-old Who Didn’t Know Her House Was On Fire appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Good News in History, August 6
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
50 years ago today, the landmark Voting Rights Act of 1965 became US law. Designed to prohibit racial discrimination in voting and enforce the rights guaranteed by the 14th and 15th Amendments to the US Constitution, the Act resulted in the mass enfranchisement of racial minorities, especially in the South.

The post Good News in History, August 6 appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: “Chicken Lady” Found Courage To Ask For Leftovers, Still Feeding Homeless
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
For Amy Murphy, the hardest part of feeding the homeless was working up the nerve to ask a restaurant for leftovers. After that, finding the courage to wear a chicken hat in public every day was a piece of cake. The people in Greensboro, North Carolina know Murphy as the

The post “Chicken Lady” Found Courage To Ask For Leftovers, Still Feeding Homeless appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: UPS Cuts Greenhouse Gases with 46Mil Gallons of Renewable Diesel
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
United Parcel Service (UPS) has committed to buying 46 million gallons of renewable diesel made from waste oils and animal fats, delivering on its promise to cut petroleum-based fuel use by 12% in the next two years. Renewable diesel produces up to 90% less greenhouse gas emissions than conventional diesel.

The post UPS Cuts Greenhouse Gases with 46Mil Gallons of Renewable Diesel appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Trophy-Hunted Lion’s Tragedy Leads to Animal Rights Triumphs
item.dc:creator: Helaina Hovitz
item.description:
On July 2, Cecil, a 13-year-old male Southwest African lion, was killed in a hunting expedition in Zimbabwe. A main attraction at the Hwange National Park, Cecil was shot with a cross bow by an American dentist who was led by a licensed local game-hunter. Whether he believed he had the proper

The post Trophy-Hunted Lion’s Tragedy Leads to Animal Rights Triumphs appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Skyrocketing Donations Save the First Spacesuit Worn on the Moon
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
When the Smithsonian Institution took the small step of launching a Kickstarter campaign to save the spacesuit Neil Armstrong wore on the first moonwalk, there was a giant leap of donations. The museum reached its half-million dollar goal to “Reboot the Suit” in just five days — so it raised

The post Skyrocketing Donations Save the First Spacesuit Worn on the Moon appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Adorable: Bride Has 89-year-old Grandmother as One of Her Bridesmaids
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
At Christine Quinn’s Pennsylvania wedding in May, one of her bridesmaids was her 89-year-old grandmother. Nana Betty was hesitant at first, worried that she wasn’t as “young and pretty” as the other bridesmaids—but the sassy senior happily donned the same dress as the other ladies in the bridal party–and even joined

The post Adorable: Bride Has 89-year-old Grandmother as One of Her Bridesmaids appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Homeless Shelter’s 80-Bed Rooftop Garden Cultivates Fresh Food and Job Skills
item.dc:creator: Linda Hernandez
item.description:
Shelter residents are harvesting organic produce to nourish themselves while growing their skills for an eventual return to the workforce. The Metro Atlanta Task Force for the Homeless started its rooftop garden in 2009 to teach homeless people about urban farming and organic food production. Now the gardeners harvest from 80

The post Homeless Shelter’s 80-Bed Rooftop Garden Cultivates Fresh Food and Job Skills appeared first on Good News Network.
